intro: Consolida stocksiana var. kabuliana, commonly known as the Persian candytuft, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, branched stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
